intro: Mezoneuron furfuraceum, commonly known as the hairy mezoneuron, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The species is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
